Description of incident: The SEGA Pass website was hit by hackers sometime around June 16.  Sega Europe in London operates the website, but customers worldwide may have been affected.  No credit card information was exposed, but names, dates of birth, email addresses and encrypted passwords were stolen by the hackers. Sega recommends that customers change login information for other sites if they used the same login information for SEGA Pass. Sega reported that 1,290,755 customers were affected.
